org.strykeforce.thirdcoast.telemetry

Class TelemetryService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.strykeforce.thirdcoast.telemetry.TelemetryService

  • @Singleton
public class TelemetryService
extends Object
    The Telemetry service registers Item instances for data collection and controls the starting and stopping of the service. When active, the services listens for incoming control messages via a HTTP REST service and sends data over UDP.

      Default constructor.

public TelemetryService()

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the Telemetry service and listen for client connections.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the Telemetry service.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Un-register all Items.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if TelemetryService is running.

      • register

        public void register(CANTalon talon)
        Register a Talon for telemetry sending and set its CAN bus frame rates to default values. If this Talon is already registered the frame rates are not updated.
        Parameters:
        talon - the CANTalon to register for data collection
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if TelemetryService is running.
        See Also:
        StatusFrameRate

      • register

        public void register(Item item)
        Registers an Item for telemetry sending.
        Parameters:
        item - the Item to register for data collection
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if TelemetryService is running.

      • registerAll

        public void registerAll(Collection<Item> collection)
        Register a collection for telemetry sending.
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection of Items to register for data collection
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if TelemetryService is running.

      • configureStatusFrameRates

        public void configureStatusFrameRates(int talonId,
                                      StatusFrameRate rates)
        Configure the Talon with the given ID with the given status frame rates.
        Parameters:
        talonId - the Talon to registerWith
        rates - the status frame rates

      • getItems

        public Set<Item> getItems()
        Get an unmodifiable view of the registered items.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable Set of Items.

      • remove

        public void remove(Item item)
        Unregister an Item from a stopped TelemetryService.
        Parameters:
        item - the Item to remove.
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if TelemetryService is running.
